Enigmatic Spellcasting.name: Enigmatic Spellcasting
Enigmatic Spellcasting.flavor: You reach into the weave of arcane energy and exchange the magic of one spell for another.
Enigmatic Spellcasting.effect: Choose an unexpended wizard daily utility power that you have prepared. You instantly prepare a different wizard daily utility power in its place. The new power must be from your spellbook and of the same level as the old power.

Enigmatic Spell Lore.name: Enigmatic Spell Lore
Enigmatic Spell Lore.flavor: Unraveling the magic of one spell, you call forth another one from you spellbook—a spell just right to put your foe in its place.
Enigmatic Spell Lore.effect: Choose an unexpended wizard encounter attack power that you have prepared. You instantly prepare a different wizard encounter attack power in its place. The new power must be from your spellbook and no higher in level than the old power.

Otto's Twisting Tune.name: Otto's Twisting Tune
Otto's Twisting Tune.flavor: Your magic reaches deep into the target’s heart and mind to twist its allegiances.
Otto's Twisting Tune.onHit: You slide the target up to its speed. The target then makes a melee basic attack against a creature of your choice as a free action. The target gains a power bonus to the attack roll and the damage roll equal to your implement's enhancement bonus.
Otto's Twisting Tune.effect: The target is dazed until the end of your next turn.

Otto's Song of Fidelity.name: Otto's Song of Fidelity
Otto's Song of Fidelity.flavor: As you speak, each creature that hears you feels the power of your magic, forcing it to become an eager vassal to your will.
Otto's Song of Fidelity.requirement: You must be outside a combat encounter.
Otto's Song of Fidelity.effect:
The target makes a saving throw. The saving throw has a +5 bonus if the target is the same level as you or a higher level. It takes a -5 penalty if the target is a lower level than you or does not have a level.
    If the saving throw succeeds, this power has no effect. The target is aware that you used this power on it if it is the same level as you or a higher level. Otherwise, it does not know you used this power.
    On a failed saving throw, the target treats you as a trusted friend for 6 hours. It truthfully answers all questions you ask, and aids you in any way it can as long as doing so does not risk its life or property. While the target is under this effect, you gain a +5 power bonus to Bluff checks against it.
    If you or any of your allies attacks the target or any of its allies, the effect ends on that target. Afterward, the target doesn’t remember that you used this power against it.

Otto's Inevitable Command.name: Otto's Inevitable Command
Otto's Inevitable Command.flavor: You speak a word of power, compelling your enemy to heed your will. Even if it resists you this time, your magic continues to echo in its mind.
Otto's Inevitable Command.onHit: The target is dominated until the end of your next turn. If you or any of your allies attacks the target or any of its allies, or if the target makes an attack, takes damage, or causes one of its allies to take damage, this effect ends. In addition, at the start of each of the target’s turns, you can slide it up to 6 squares as a free action.
Otto's Inevitable Command.sustainStandard: The dominated condition persists until the end of your next turn, subject to the same ending conditions as above.
Otto's Inevitable Command.onMiss: You do not expend this power. If you use it on the same target before the end of the encounter, you gain a +2 power bonus to the attack roll.

Kelgore's Undeniable Fire.name: Kelgore's Undeniable Fire
Kelgore's Undeniable Fire.flavor: You whisper the words of the undeniable fire, causing your enemy to be scoured by elemental flame from the inside out.
Kelgore's Undeniable Fire.special: If the implement used with this power has an enhancement bonus, add that bonus to the damage.

Kelgore's Well of Power.name: Kelgore's Well of Power
Kelgore's Well of Power.flavor: You draw arcane energy into your body, straining beyond your physical limits to unleash devastating power.
Kelgore's Well of Power.requirement: You must have at least one healing surge remaining.
Kelgore's Well of Power.effect: You spend a healing surge but do not regain any hit points. Instead, the next time you make an attack with a wizard attack power or a wizard paragon path attack power before the end of your next turn, the attack deals 2d10 extra damage.

Kelgore's Rain of Fire.name: Kelgore's Rain of Fire
Kelgore's Rain of Fire.flavor: With a shout, you draw down elemental fire to scour the battlefield like an endless rain.
Kelgore's Rain of Fire.effect: The burst creates a zone that lasts until the end of the encounter. While the zone persists, you can take the following actions.
Kelgore's Rain of Fire.standardAction: Each creature in the zone takes 10 + Intelligence modifier fire damage.
Kelgore's Rain of Fire.moveAction: You move the zone up to 3 squares.

Nolzur's Shade Spell.name: Nolzur's Shade Spell
Nolzur's Shade Spell.flavor: You create an illusion of a spell you have studied, duplicating its effect so perfectly that illusion becomes reality.
Nolzur's Shade Spell.effect: Choose a wizard encounter attack power in your spellbook of up to 7th level. You can use a shade version of that power once before the end of the encounter. The shade power gains the illusion keyword. If it targets a defense, it targets Will instead of the defense the power normally targets. It is otherwise identical to the original power, including action type and usage.

Nolzur's Phantom Vigor.name: Nolzur's Phantom Vigor
Nolzur's Phantom Vigor.flavor: Your magic creates the illusion of soothing warmth and boundless vigor, granting an ally the energy to fight on.
Nolzur's Phantom Vigor.target: You or one ally; the target must have a healing surge
Nolzur's Phantom Vigor.effect: The target loses a healing surge and gains temporary hit points equal to his or her healing surge value.

Nolzur's Phantom Spell.name: Nolzur's Phantom Spell
Nolzur's Phantom Spell.flavor: Your mastery of illusion is such that your magic bends reality and perception in equal measure.
Nolzur's Phantom Spell.effect: Choose a wizard encounter attack power or a wizard daily attack power in your spellbook of up to 19th level. You can use a phantom version of that power once before the end of the encounter. The phantom power gains the illusion keyword. If it targets a defense, it targets Will instead of the defense the power normally targets. It is otherwise identical to the original power, including action type and usage.

Kelwyn's Devouring Fire.name: Kelwyn's Devouring Fire
Kelwyn's Devouring Fire.flavor: A sheet of flames roars forth from your hands, burning all in its path.
Kelwyn's Devouring Fire.onMiss: Half damage, or slide the target up to 4 squares and it must end the slide outside the blast. If it cannot end the slide outside the blast, it instead takes half damage.
Kelwyn's Devouring Fire.effect: If you kill one or more creatures with this attack, all creatures in the blast take fire damage equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier. Apply this extra damage after attacking all the targets.

Kelwyn's Fiery Form.name: Kelwyn's Fiery Form
Kelwyn's Fiery Form.flavor: You become a creature of fire as you give both body and soul over to the power you command. For a few moments, it now commands you.
Kelwyn's Fiery Form.effect: You transform into a humanoid creature of ash and fire. Until the end of the encounter, you gain immunity to fire and a power bonus to damage rolls with fire attacks equal to the number of targets of the attack. If one of those targets is an ally, the bonus increases by an additional +4. Creatures that end their turns adjacent to you take 5 + your Constitution modifier fire damage.

Kelwyn's Final Devastation.name: Kelwyn's Final Devastation
Kelwyn's Final Devastation.flavor: You gather and then channel fiery energy that chars your flesh as you unleash a blast of fire.
Kelwyn's Final Devastation.effect: You take damage equal to your bloodied value. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

Nulathoe's Concussive Demise.name: Nulathoe's Concussive Demise
Nulathoe's Concussive Demise.flavor: A dying creature explodes with sudden destructive power.
Nulathoe's Concussive Demise.trigger: A creature dies within 10 squares of you.
Nulathoe's Concussive Demise.target: Each creature in the burst centered on the triggering creature
Nulathoe's Concussive Demise.effect: You push each target up to 3 squares away from the burst’s origin square.

Nulathoe's Death Ward.name: Nulathoe's Death Ward
Nulathoe's Death Ward.flavor: You weave a potent ward that thwarts death’s cold touch.
Nulathoe's Death Ward.target: You and each ally in the burst
Nulathoe's Death Ward.effect:
Each target gains the following benefits until the end of the encounter.
    * Resist 10 necrotic
    * +2 power bonus to death saving throws and saving throws against effects that slow or weaken
    * Immunity to being turned into an undead creature

Nulathoe's Undead Army.name: Nulathoe's Undead Army
Nulathoe's Undead Army.flavor: A motley host of animated flesh, bone, and teeth claw their way free from the earth, rising up in answer to your summons.
Nulathoe's Undead Army.requirement: You must have at least one healing surge.
Nulathoe's Undead Army.effect:
You lose a healing surge. You then summon up to five undead soldier minions in unoccupied squares in the burst. They are allies to you and your allies.
    The soldiers lack actions of their own. Instead, you spend actions to command them mentally, choosing from the actions in their description. You must have line of effect to a particular soldier for it to respond to your commands. When you command a soldier, you and the soldier share knowledge but not senses.
    When a soldier makes an attack roll or a check, you make the roll using your game statistics, not including any temporary bonuses or penalties.
    Each soldier remains until you take an extended rest, until you dismiss it as a minor action, or until it drops to 0 hit points (which does not cause you to lose a healing surge).

Evard's Wrenching Darkness.name: Evard's Wrenching Darkness
Evard's Wrenching Darkness.flavor: Darkness envelops an enemy and whisks it away, spreading bitter fear among your other foes.
keywords: Arcane, Fear, Implement, Nethermancy, Psychic, Shadow
Evard's Wrenching Darkness.onHit: 1d10 + Intelligence modifier psychic damage. You slide the target up to 5 squares, and the target is immobilized until the end of your next turn.
Evard's Wrenching Darkness.effect: After the attack, each enemy within 2 squares of the target is pushed up to 2 squares away from it and grants combat advantage until the start of your next turn.

Evard's All-Seeing Worm.name: Evard's All-Seeing Worm
Evard's All-Seeing Worm.flavor: The writhing worm you hurl at your ally burrows into his or her flesh to create a tiny opening through which you can see.
Evard's All-Seeing Worm.effect: The target takes necrotic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier. Until the end of the encounter, while you have line of effect to the target, you can see as if you are in both your space and the target’s, and when you use a wizard attack power or a wizard paragon path attack power, you can do so as if you were in either space, although you physically remain in yours.

Evard's Black Gate.name: Evard's Black Gate
Evard's Black Gate.flavor: A black disk yawns wide, expanding like an eye’s pupil in the dark. From its dull surface emerge writhing black tentacles, which ensnare your foes and drag them into oblivion.
Evard's Black Gate.effect: You conjure a wall that lasts until the end of your next turn. The wall can be up to 2 squares high, and its squares are totally obscured. While in the wall, a creature is dazed and can attack only creatures adjacent to it. While the wall persists, you can use the secondary power at will.
Evard's Black Gate.sustainMinor: The wall persists until the end of your next turn.
Evard's Black Gate.requirement: The power Evard's Black Gate must be active in order to use this power.
Evard's Black Gate.onHit: 2d8 + Intelligence modifier necrotic damage, and the target is pulled up to 2 squares toward the wall and into it, if possible. The target is restrained (save ends).
